subject: Mathematics
title: Concentration of Measure (TUM, Module CIT4100004)
description: Master-level module on concentration of measure inequalities and techniques (Chernoff, Hoeffding, Bernstein, isoperimetric/Poincaré/Gromov–Milman, martingales/Azuma, Johnson–Lindenstrauss) with applications. Workload 150 h (45 h contact), 5 ECTS, offered irregularly. Version 2022s responsible: Warzel, Simone.

goals.title: Concentration of Measure – Module Overview
goals.description: Students understand and can apply key concentration of measure inequalities and techniques to examples relevant to theoretical/mathematical physics and probability.
goals.descriptionEn: Students understand and can apply key concentration of measure inequalities and techniques to examples relevant to theoretical/mathematical physics and probability.

goals.title: Foundations and Classical Inequalities
goals.description: Learner can state and apply classical concentration inequalities (Chernoff, Hoeffding, Bernstein) and isoperimetric inequalities.
goals.descriptionEn: Learner can state and apply classical concentration inequalities (Chernoff, Hoeffding, Bernstein) and isoperimetric inequalities.

goals.title: Martingale Methods and Azuma
goals.description: Learner can use martingale techniques and Azuma’s inequality for concentration in dependent settings.
goals.descriptionEn: Learner can use martingale techniques and Azuma’s inequality for concentration in dependent settings.

goals.title: Geometric and Functional Inequalities
goals.description: Learner can explain Poincaré inequalities, Gromov–Milman theorem and related functional/metric concentration results.
goals.descriptionEn: Learner can explain Poincaré inequalities, Gromov–Milman theorem and related functional/metric concentration results.

goals.title: Johnson–Lindenstrauss and Dimension Reduction
goals.description: Learner can apply Johnson–Lindenstrauss inequality for dimensionality reduction and understand its concentration basis.
goals.descriptionEn: Learner can apply Johnson–Lindenstrauss inequality for dimensionality reduction and understand its concentration basis.

goals.title: Applications and Examples
goals.description: Learner can select and apply suitable concentration tools to examples from the course (probability/physics contexts) and interpret results.
goals.descriptionEn: Learner can select and apply suitable concentration tools to examples from the course (probability/physics contexts) and interpret results.
